de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.iterator

Class AbstractItemIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.iterator.AbstractItemIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<AbstractItem>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractTabSwitcherLayout.InitialItemIterator, ArrayItemIterator, ItemIterator

    public abstract class AbstractItemIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<AbstractItem>
    An abstract base class for all iterators, which allow to iterate items of the type AbstractItem.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractItemIterator.AbstractBuilder<BuilderType extends AbstractItemIterator.AbstractBuilder<?,ProductType>,ProductType extends AbstractItemIterator>
      An abstract base class of all builders, which allows to configure and create instances of the class AbstractItemIterator.

        public AbstractItemIterator()

    • Method Detail

      • getCount

        public abstract int getCount()
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses in order to retrieve the total number of available items.
        Returns:
        The total number of available items as an Integer value

      • getItem

        @NonNull
public abstract AbstractItem getItem(int index)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses in order to retrieve the item, which corresponds to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, which should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The item, which corresponds to the given index, as an instance of the class AbstractItem. The item may not be null

      • initialize

        protected final void initialize(boolean reverse,
                                int start)
        Initializes the iterator.
        Parameters:
        reverse - True, if the items should be iterated in reverse order, false otherwise
        start - The index of the first item, which should be iterated, as an Integer value or -1, if all items should be iterated

      • first

        public final AbstractItem first()
        Returns the first item. Calling this method does not alter the current position of the iterator.
        Returns:
        The first item as an instance of the class AbstractItem or null, if no items are available

      • previous

        public final AbstractItem previous()
        Returns the previous item. Calling this method does not alter the current position of the iterator.
        Returns:
        The previous item as an instance of the class AbstractItem or null, if no previous item is available

      • peek

        public final AbstractItem peek()
        Returns the next item. Calling this method does not alter the current position of the iterator.
        Returns:
        The next item as an instance of the class AbstractItem or null, if no next item is available

      • hasNext

        public final boolean hasNext()
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator<AbstractItem>

      • next

        public final AbstractItem next()
        Specified by:
